title: How to deploy a React application to Github page?
description: Github gives us a free domain and repository to create own page, instead of creating a boring static page, can we make it as a dynamic single web app?. In this article, I would like to show you how to make and deploy a simple React project to Github page
content:
In this article, I would like to show you how to deploy a React application to your Github page.

1. Create a repository for your page.
Head over to GitHub and create a new public repository named username.github.io, where username is your username (or organization name) on GitHub.

2. Initialize your React application.
There is many ways to initilize your React application. But for me, I recommend you to use create-react-app project to make it simple.
In the terminal, just typing: 

npx create-react-app <app_name>

If you want your application support typescript, you just add the template argument.

npx create-react-app <app_name> -template typescript

After the script run successfully, try start your boilterplate application by running:

yarn install && yarn run start

Check again your application by browsing the localhost in port 3000

3. Add Gh-Pages dependency and setup deployment scripts
First of all, you need to add your git remote to your local repository:

git remote add origin git@github.com:<username>/<username>.github.io.git

Next step, install the gh-pages dependency:

yarn add gh-pages

Open your package.json and append more 2 scripts into scripts tag:

{ 
"scripts": {
    "predeploy": "yarn run build",
    "deploy": "gh-pages -d build"
 }
}

 

4. Build and deploy your application
For above steps, you just finish ~80% workload. Now, just do your first deployment by running:

yarn run deploy

Now, let's check your site by browsing to <username>.github.io

Good luck.
